messages.content: You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Mn2N is trigonal omega structured and crystallizes in the trigonal P-3m1 space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of one Mn2N sheet oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. Mn(1) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Mn(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.98 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Mn(1) atoms to form edge-sharing NMn6 octahedra. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.36530449507183704 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Mn2N is zeta iron carbide-like structured and crystallizes in the orthorhombic Pbcn space group. Mn(1) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. There are a spread of Mn(1)-N(1) bond distances ranging from 1.95-1.98 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Mn(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NMn6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 49°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.435483445905172 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Mn3N2 crystallizes in the monoclinic C2/m space group. There are two inequivalent Mn sites. In the first Mn site, Mn(1) is bonded in a distorted trigonal non-coplanar geometry to four equivalent N(1) atoms. There are three shorter (1.84 Å) and one longer (2.49 Å) Mn(1)-N(1) bond length. In the second Mn site, Mn(2) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form edge-sharing MnN6 octahedra. There are two shorter (2.24 Å) and four longer (2.28 Å) Mn(2)-N(1) bond lengths. N(1) is bonded in a 7-coordinate geometry to three equivalent Mn(2) and four equivalent Mn(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.196312870814654 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Mn3N2 crystallizes in the tetragonal I4/mmm space group. There are two inequivalent Mn sites. In the first Mn site, Mn(1) is bonded to five equivalent N(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing MnN5 square pyramids. There are four shorter (2.03 Å) and one longer (2.06 Å) Mn(1)-N(1) bond length. In the second Mn site, Mn(2) is bonded in a linear geometry to two equivalent N(1) atoms. Both Mn(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.93 Å. N(1) is bonded to one Mn(2) and five equivalent Mn(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NMn6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 0-6°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.29638316681465404 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Mn3N4 crystallizes in the hexagonal P6_3/m space group. Mn(1) is bonded in a 5-coordinate geometry to two equivalent N(2) and three equivalent N(1) atoms. Both Mn(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.00 Å. There is one shorter (1.77 Å) and two longer (1.86 Å) Mn(1)-N(1) bond lengths. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(2) is bonded to six equivalent Mn(1) atoms to form distorted face-sharing NMn6 pentagonal pyramids. In the second N site, N(1) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to three equivalent Mn(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.12126027236761301 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Mn3N4 is Corundum-like structured and crystallizes in the orthorhombic Pnma space group. There are three inequivalent Mn sites. In the first Mn site, Mn(1) is bonded to two equivalent N(1), two equivalent N(2), and two equivalent N(3) atoms to form MnN6 octahedra that share corners with four equivalent Mn(2)N6 octahedra, corners with two equivalent Mn(3)N4 tetrahedra, edges with two equivalent Mn(1)N6 octahedra, edges with two equivalent Mn(2)N6 octahedra, and edges with two equivalent Mn(3)N4 tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 49-51°. Both Mn(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.95 Å. Both Mn(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.00 Å. Both Mn(1)-N(3) bond lengths are 2.00 Å. In the second Mn site, Mn(2) is bonded to one N(1), one N(2), and four equivalent N(3) atoms to form MnN6 octahedra that share corners with four equivalent Mn(1)N6 octahedra, corners with four equivalent Mn(2)N6 octahedra, corners with four equivalent Mn(3)N4 tetrahedra, edges with two equivalent Mn(1)N6 octahedra, and  an edgeedge with one Mn(3)N4 tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 47-51°. The Mn(2)-N(1) bond length is 1.96 Å. The Mn(2)-N(2) bond length is 2.01 Å. All Mn(2)-N(3) bond lengths are 2.02 Å. In the third Mn site, Mn(3) is bonded to one N(1), one N(2), and two equivalent N(3) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing MnN4 tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 58-62°. The Mn(3)-N(1) bond length is 1.77 Å. The Mn(3)-N(2) bond length is 1.79 Å. Both Mn(3)-N(3) bond lengths are 1.79 Å. There are three inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to one Mn(2), one Mn(3), and two equivalent Mn(1) atoms to form distorted corner-sharing NMn4 trigonal pyramids. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded in a rectangular see-saw-like geometry to one Mn(2), one Mn(3), and two equivalent Mn(1) atoms. In the third N site, N(3) is bonded in a rectangular see-saw-like geometry to one Mn(1), one Mn(3), and two equivalent Mn(2) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.20366105522475403 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Mn4N crystallizes in the cubic Pm-3m space group. There are two inequivalent Mn sites. In the first Mn site, Mn(1) is bonded to twelve equivalent Mn(2) atoms to form MnMn12 cuboctahedra that share corners with twelve equivalent Mn(1)Mn12 cuboctahedra, faces with six equivalent Mn(1)Mn12 cuboctahedra, and faces with eight equivalent N(1)Mn6 octahedra. All Mn(1)-Mn(2) bond lengths are 2.82 Å. In the second Mn site, Mn(2) is bonded in a linear geometry to four equivalent Mn(1) and two equivalent N(1) atoms. Both Mn(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.99 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Mn(2) atoms to form NMn6 octahedra that share corners with six equivalent N(1)Mn6 octahedra and faces with eight equivalent Mn(1)Mn12 cuboctahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.295696929336207 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Mn4N crystallizes in the cubic Pm-3m space group. The structure consists of one ammonia atom inside a Mn framework. In the Mn framework, there are two inequivalent Mn sites. In the first Mn site, Mn(1) is bonded to six equivalent Mn(2) atoms to form corner-sharing MnMn6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Mn(1)-Mn(2) bond lengths are 2.16 Å. In the second Mn site, Mn(2) is bonded in a linear geometry to two equivalent Mn(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 1.691357588663791 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

MnN is Tetraauricupride structured and crystallizes in the cubic Pm-3m space group. Mn(1) is bonded in a body-centered cubic geometry to eight equivalent N(1) atoms. All Mn(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.19 Å. N(1) is bonded in a body-centered cubic geometry to eight equivalent Mn(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 0.396351690571119 eV/atom.

MnN is Zincblende, Sphalerite structured and crystallizes in the cubic F-43m space group. Mn(1) is bonded to four equivalent N(1) atoms to form corner-sharing MnN4 tetrahedra. All Mn(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.83 Å. N(1) is bonded to four equivalent Mn(1) atoms to form corner-sharing NMn4 tetrahedra. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.083899999999999 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.31152661661637904 eV/atom.

MnN crystallizes in the monoclinic Pm space group. There are two inequivalent Mn sites. In the first Mn site, Mn(1) is bonded to one N(1) and four equivalent N(2) atoms to form distorted MnN5 trigonal bipyramids that share corners with six equivalent Mn(2)N4 tetrahedra, corners with four equivalent Mn(1)N5 trigonal bipyramids, edges with two equivalent Mn(2)N4 tetrahedra, and edges with four equivalent Mn(1)N5 trigonal bipyramids. The Mn(1)-N(1) bond length is 1.90 Å. There are two shorter (2.12 Å) and two longer (2.17 Å) Mn(1)-N(2) bond lengths. In the second Mn site, Mn(2) is bonded to two equivalent N(1) and two equivalent N(2) atoms to form MnN4 tetrahedra that share corners with four equivalent Mn(2)N4 tetrahedra, corners with six equivalent Mn(1)N5 trigonal bipyramids, and edges with two equivalent Mn(1)N5 trigonal bipyramids. There is one shorter (1.74 Å) and one longer (1.75 Å) Mn(2)-N(1) bond length. Both Mn(2)-N(2) bond lengths are 1.95 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded in a distorted trigonal planar geometry to one Mn(1) and two equivalent Mn(2) atoms. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to two equivalent Mn(2) and four equivalent Mn(1) atoms to form a mixture of distorted corner, edge, and face-sharing NMn6 pentagonal pyramids. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.05537825442888 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Mn(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.07 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Mn(1) atoms to form a mixture of corner and edge-sharing NMn6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?

All Mn(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.87 Å. N(1) is bonded to four equivalent Mn(1) atoms to form corner-sharing NMn4 tetrahedra.
